message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.RO 

This paper deals with a neuron model that is able to learn temporal features of spike input patterns through morphological changes in its structure. This falls under the category of neural networks and learning systems, which is covered by cs.NE. Additionally, the paper discusses a learning algorithm that adapts the threshold of the neuron during training, which is a common topic in machine learning and artificial intelligence, covered by cs.LG and cs.AI. The paper also presents experimental results on hardware implementation, which falls under the category of robotics and control systems, covered by cs.RO. Finally, the paper applies the proposed learning rule to real-life spike classification problems, which is a topic in systems and control, covered by cs.SY.
